job_description: Join Verition Fund Management in this exciting opportunity.

Why RTI

RTI International is an independent, scientific research institute dedicated to improving the human condition. Our vision is to address the world's most critical problems with technical and science-based solutions in pursuit of a better future. Clients rely on us to answer questions that demand an objective and multidisciplinary approach—one that integrates expertise across social, statistical, data, and laboratory sciences, engineering, and other technical disciplines to solve the world’s most challenging problems.

We believe in the promise of science and technical solutions, and we push ourselves every day to deliver on that promise for the good of people, communities, and businesses in the US and around the world. If you are looking for the opportunity to make a real difference, RTI is the place for you.


About the Hiring Group

 

RTI’s Finance Organization is seeking Financial Analyst interns to join a CFO Pricing Operations team. The Financial Analyst Intern will play a key role in supporting the Pricing team’s budget and cost proposal development processes.

 


What You'll Do

Scope of Work

This opportunity will provide experience in the RTI Finance organization as well as exposure to the Federal government contracting industry, among others. Interns will gain skills in finance, budgeting, critical thinking, problem solving, communication, and collaboration in a team environment.

 

Responsibilities      

  • Actively participate in RTI’s onboarding process to learn RTI’s financial processes and procedures.
  • Review documents to identify financial or contractual risk issues.
  • Accurately prepare budgets and financial reports in a timely manner.
  • Compile documentation to submit in business proposals to a variety of clients including federal, state and local, international, commercial, foundations, etc.
  • Update data in financial pricing software and obtain necessary reviews.
  • Collaborate with RTI pricing analysts and other cross-functional team members on a variety of proposals.
  • Research information as needed on share drives, internal websites, or other databases.
  • Perform other finance-related duties, projects, or cross-training as assigned.

Internship Learning Objectives       

  • Develop and improve skills such as critical thinking, written and verbal communication, research, technology, teamwork, leadership, and belonging.
  • Demonstrate professionalism by building integrity through strong work ethic, personal accountability, ethical behavior, and effective communication.

What You'll Need

Required Qualifications 

  • Junior or Senior currently enrolled in a 4-year university, majoring in business, finance, economics, accounting, or a related field.
  • US citizen or permanent resident.
  • Proficiency in using Microsoft Office (e.g., Adobe, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) and compiling multiple documents into a single, clearly formatted PDF volume.
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy with work.
  • Related experience and interest in government contracting, financial analysis, project management, and/or risk assessment.

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Analytical skills using financial tools such as excel, SmartView, etc.
  • Capable of working independently and with teammates.
  • Passion for continuous improvement and learning.
  • Demonstrates sound judgement.

EEO & Pay Equity Statements

For San Francisco, CA USA Job Postings Only: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Further information is available here.

 

RTI accepts applications to our job openings from candidates with criminal histories or conviction records in accordance with all applicable laws, including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

 

For Applicants in Massachusetts Only: It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

 

The anticipated pay range for this role is listed below. Our pay ranges represent national averages and may vary by location as a geographic differential may be applied to some locations within the United States. RTI considers multiple factors when making an offer including, for example: established salary range, internal budget, business needs, and education and years of work experience possessed by the applicant. Further, salary is merely one element to our offer.


At RTI, we demonstrate our commitment to rewarding individual and team achievement through a total rewards package. This package includes (among other things) a competitive base salary, a generous paid time off policy, merit based annual increases, bonus opportunities and a robust recognition program. Other benefits include a competitive range of insurance plans (including health, dental, life, and short-term and long-term disability), access to a retirement savings program such as a 401(k) plan, paid parental leave for all parents, financial assistance with adoption expenses or infertility treatments, financial reimbursement for education and developmental opportunities, an employee assistance program, and numerous other offerings to support a healthy work-life balance.


Equal Pay Act Minimum/Range

$20.00/hour

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>At CVS Health, we are focused on transforming health care for our customers and making our company a great place to work. We help people navigate the health care system – and their personal health care – by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. Within our Retail locations, we bring this promise to life with heart every day. Our 3rd year Pharmacy Interns play a critical role in supporting our pharmacy teams to consistently deliver on our brand promise, while developing their own skills in preparation for increasing responsibility.</p><p></p><p>As a 3rd year Pharmacy Intern, you will be focused on applying didactic learning from pharmacy school into real-world practice to become ready for a Pharmacist role. Under the direction of your preceptor, you will complete a comprehensive training roadmap designed to show you first-hand what it’s like to be part of a pharmacy team while gaining an overview of store, district, and regional operations. You will gain valuable hands-on experience through a training roadmap that includes a combination of Key Learning Experiences (KLEs), activities, and time spent with leaders in your district. While in the pharmacy, you will assist the pharmacy team to ensure that pharmacy operations run smoothly, our patients’ prescriptions are filled promptly, safely, and accurately, and we are providing caring service that exceeds patient expectations. You will learn to operate as part of the pharmacy team through consistent application of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), best practices, and effective communication. Throughout your shifts and in all customer and colleague interactions, you will learn to demonstrate empathy and genuine care, and contribute to a safe and inclusive culture where all people feel valued and empowered.</p><p></p><p>3rd year Pharmacy Interns are responsible for completion of a comprehensive training roadmap, focusing on KLEs that build aptitude in the following areas. As tenure increases, 3rd year Pharmacy Interns take on increasing responsibility of the safety and effectiveness of operations in the pharmacy, including but not limited to: </p><p></p><ul><li>Living our purpose by following all company SOPs at each workstation to help our Pharmacists and Technicians manage and improve patient health</li><li>Following pharmacy workflow procedures at each pharmacy workstation (i.e., production, pick-up, drive-thru, and drop-off) for safe and accurate prescription fulfillment</li><li>Contributing to positive patient experiences showing empathy and genuine care: creating heartfelt and personalized moments while serving patients at pick-up, drive-thru, and over the phone; keeping patients healthy by offering immunizations and other services at the register and over the phone; and demonstrating compassionate care by solving or escalating patient problems</li><li>Offering to counsel, fielding medical questions, and soliciting information on a patient’s medical history to provide optimal care, when appropriate under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist</li><li>Taking telephonic prescriptions from the prescriber, and calling the prescriber to clarify prescriptions or facilitate medication changes, where allowed by state regulation</li><li>Maintaining the highest level of self-awareness and providing in-the-moment coaching, training, and mentoring to pharmacy team members while sharing best practices</li><li>Completing basic inventory activities, as permitted by law, and as directed by the pharmacy leadership team, such as accurately putting away medication deliveries and completing cycle counts, returns-to-stocks, waiting bin inventories, etc.</li><li>Contributing to a high-performing team, embracing a growth mindset, and being receptive to feedback; actively seeking opportunities to expand clinical and technical knowledge needed to better assist patients</li><li>Remaining flexible for both scheduling and business needs, while contributing to a safe, inclusive, and engaging team dynamic; voluntarily traveling to stores in the market to work shifts as needed by the business</li><li>Understanding and complying with all relevant federal, state, and local laws, regulations, professional standards, and ethical principles. Complying with CVS policies and procedures to ensure patient safety, compliance with controlled substance dispensing and recordkeeping, and to protect patient privacy and security</li><li>Delivering additional patient health care services (e.g., immunizations, point-of-care testing, and voluntarily staffing offsite clinics), where allowable by law and supported by required training and certification</li></ul><p></p><p>Where permissible, the 3rd year Pharmacy Intern may also support immunizations, which includes the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Completing additional licensure and training requirements, in compliance with state Board of Pharmacy regulations, to obtain Technician Immunizer status to support preparing and administering vaccines</li><li>Educating patients about the importance of vaccines and referring patients to the Pharmacist-on-duty for vaccination questions</li><li>Monitoring for, and responding to, adverse reactions; reporting adverse reaction events per public health requirements</li><li>Reviewing and collecting patient information; tracking and documenting for each applicable patient</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li>Accepted into, or actively enrolled in, an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>Must possess, or be in the process of obtaining, valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Essential Functions:</b></p><ul><li>Regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Ability to complete required training within designated timeframe</li><li>Attention and Focus:<ul><li>Ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time</li><li>Ability to pivot quickly from one task to another to meet patient and business needs</li><li>Ability to confirm prescription information and label accuracy, ensuring patient safety</li></ul></li><li>Customer Service and Team Orientation:<ul><li>Actively look for ways to help people, and do so in a friendly manner</li><li>Notice and understand patients’ reactions, and respond appropriately</li></ul></li><li>Communication Skills:<ul><li>Use and understand verbal and written communication to interact with patients and colleagues</li><li>Utilize active listening by giving full attention to what others are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times</li></ul></li><li>Mathematical Reasoning:<ul><li>Ability to use math to solve a problem, such as determining the total number of tablets to dispense, day’s supply, and/or number of full bottles and additional bottles needed to fill a prescription</li></ul></li><li>Problem Resolution:<ul><li>Identifying challenging patient or colleague interactions and choosing the best course of action when faced multiple options</li></ul></li><li>Physical Demands:<ul><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Reach overhead; stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Move fingers repetitively; picking, pinching, typing, or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Control precision; quickly adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree, requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Occasionally lift of up to 20 lbs and/or exert up to 20 lbs. of force; Frequently lift of up to 10 lbs and/or exert up to 10 lbs. of force; Consistently lift and/or exert a negligible amount of force to move objects.</li><li>Express or exchange ideas by means of spoken word where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed accurately</li><li>; Have the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication</li></ul></li><li>Any additional tasks as directed by Supervisor or Manager</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Preferred Qualifications: </b></p><ul><li>1+ years of related work experience in pharmacy, retail, medical, or customer service setting</li><li>Ability to become immunization certified: Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li><li>Ability to work in home store, and across the market in other locations, to meet business needs</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.00 - $19.75<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/08/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

<p style="text-align:left">You’ve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you’ll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. At CVS Health, colleagues are committed to increasing access, lowering costs, and improving quality of care. Millions of times a day, we help people on their path to better health –from advising on prescriptions to helping manage chronic and specialty conditions. As a 3rd year pharmacy intern, you have a significant role in our company working as a part of the pharmacy team– delivering our purpose, modeling our values, and demonstrating genuine, authentic care for our patients. </p><p></p><p>While working as a 3rd year pharmacy intern, under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, you play a critical role in ensuring a safe and effective Retail Pharmacy work environment that delivers exceptional care to each patient. This includes but is not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Safety</li><li>Pharmacy Professional Practice</li><li>Regulatory Requirements</li><li>Quality Assurance</li><li>Customer Service</li><li>Inventory Management</li><li>Workflow Management excluding final prescription verification</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Primary Roles and Responsibility: </b></p><p>A key component of the pharmacy intern role is keeping your customers and patients healthy through adoption and management of patient care programs. Additionally, you will:</p><ul><li>Lead with Heart – display empathy and compassion for your patients, customers, caregivers, and colleagues on your team</li><li>Seek new ways to grow, collaborate with others, and deliver better outcomes</li><li>Align others around our purpose to bring your heart to every moment of your health and gain support and commitment</li><li>Facilitate a team culture that promotes caring, energy, enthusiasm, and pride</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Education:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Required Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>0-3 years relevant work experience</li><li>Must possess or be in process of obtaining valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Complete all required training within state guidelines and required timeframe</li><li>Ability to:<ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Finger Dexterity: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Reach overhead; able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects</li></ul></li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Ability To: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Complete any additional tasks as directed by supervisor or manager</li><li>Complete all required training and obtain required licensure (if applicable) within state guidelines</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Immunization eligibility</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $42.00<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 06/01/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

<strong>About The Company<br><br></strong>Fourier is working on making on-site Hydrogen universally accessible. Our breakthrough architecture enables highly modular and fully automated electrolyzers that scale to any size and optimize efficiency at all loads. We are on a mission to transition the global energy landscape towards a purely sustainable and emission-free future.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>This internship will involve supporting the design and validation of our commercial product. The intern will contribute to the design of a regenerative drying and purification system to enable efficient and continuous production of high-purity hydrogen. Working closely with an R&amp;D engineer, the intern will characterize thermal/separation processes, develop control systems, and optimize operating parameters to satisfy key reliability and cost constraints. As the directly responsible individual overseeing an experimental test station, the intern will develop a data analysis framework to provide key insights into long-term physicochemical phenomena. The role may involve working with vendors to design and develop custom components.<br><br><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><ul><li>Currently pursuing or recently completed a B.S. or M.S. in Chemical / Materials / Mechanical / Environmental Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or similar</li><li>Comfortable rolling up their sleeves to work with basic mechanical/electrical components, troubleshoot independently, and motivated to take ownership (agency) of hands-on lab work</li><li>Strong fundamentals and problem-solving intuition in one or more of the following areas: thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat and mass transfer, reaction kinetics, phase equilibria</li><li>Thrives in a fast-moving environment and can learn, iterate, and execute with velocity</li><li>Must be available to start in February/March 2026 and work on-site in Mountain View, CA</li><li>Highly organized with strong attention to detail and a commitment to following through (accountability)</li><li>Clear, thoughtful communicator who works well on small, collaborative teams<br><br></li></ul>

<strong>Company<br><br></strong>Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.<br><br><strong>Job Area<br><br></strong>Interns Group, Interns Group &gt; Interim Engineering Intern - SW<br><br><strong>General Summary<br><br></strong><strong>About Qualcomm<br><br></strong>Qualcomm relentlessly innovates transforming businesses, enriching lives and fortifying societies. Our solutions are pivotal in crafting a smarter, interconnected world. Building on our nearly 40-year history of era-defining technology breakthroughs, we deliver leading-edge AI, high performance, lower-power computing, and unrivaled connectivity. We’re proud to be the partner of choice to many of the world’s largest enterprises. Together with our ecosystem partners, we enable next-generation digital transformation. At Qualcomm, we are engineering human progress.<br><br><strong>Join Us in Shaping the Future<br><br></strong>At Qualcomm, we're committed to engineering human progress by delivering intelligent computing everywhere. We're passionate about harnessing the power of technology to transform industries and improve lives. Our early career programs offer limitless opportunities for growth, mentorship, and meaningful work. By joining our team, you'll be part of a community that's pushing the boundaries of what's possible in AI, computing, and connectivity. With a global footprint spanning over 30 countries, you'll have the chance to collaborate with diverse talent and contribute to projects that are shaping the future of technology.<br><br>Our early career programs are designed to attract inventive minds, offering a platform to contribute to our long-term innovation pipeline. You'll be part of a community that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. Our programs provide real-world experience, technical skills, and professional development opportunities, empowering you to make a meaningful impact and achieve your career goals. Join us for our U.S. <strong>2026 summer intern class</strong>!<br><br><strong>Role Overview<br><br></strong>As a Qualcomm <strong>Embedded Engineering Intern</strong>, you’ll have the opportunity to push the boundaries of what exists and help establish the new standards for tomorrow. You will innovate as an equal contributor on teams of world-class engineers to develop, implement, and maintain software for the most complex wireless devices in the industry today. You will leverage your computer science or engineering degree to make an immediate impact on the software development life cycle of one of Qualcomm’s numerous software technologies.<br><br>This internship supports the <strong>Embedded</strong><strong> Engineering track</strong>. Based on your resume you will be aligned to projects within this track.<br><br><strong>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or master’s degree program in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Must be available for 11–14 weeks during Summer 2026 (May–September).</li><li>Expected graduation date of November 2026 or later.</li><li>1+ years of academic experience with programming languages such as C, C++, Python, etc.<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>Candidates actively pursuing a degree with an anticipated graduation between November 2026 and June 2027</li><li>Embedded programming in C/C++/Assembly &amp; operating system knowledge</li><li>Programming in resource-constrained environments (MIPS/Memory)</li><li>Implementation of complex algorithms on an embedded processor</li><li>Embedded microcontroller programming, experience developing device drivers</li><li>Real-time embedded programming in C/C++/Assembly for general purpose and heterogeneous processors including GPUs and DSPs</li><li>Communication systems, communication theory, digital signal processing (DSP, embedded firmware)</li><li>Knowledge of wireless protocols such as 5G NR, LTE, and 802.11<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualcomm’s Internship Program<br><br></strong>Our interns join world-class teams to help define and build what is next for mobility and the world. You’ll be paired with a mentor with visibility to your project and team, receive support from your manager, and have access to the entire Qualcomm employee community to ensure your success. To round out your summer internship, we host professional development workshops, social events, cross-functional speaker sessions, and an executive speaker series. In addition to competitive hourly pay and accrued vacation time, you will receive relocation coverage and furnished housing accommodations for the duration of your internship.<br><br><strong>Internship opportunities may be available in the following locations, depending on team and project needs</strong>: Austin, Boulder, Boxborough, Bridgewater, Chandler, Irvine, New York City, Louisville, Raleigh, San Diego, Santa Clara, and Seattle.<br><br><strong>Application Process<br><br></strong>By applying here, you are expressing interest in one of our many <strong>2026 Qualcomm Embedded Engineering internships</strong>. It is important to note that this is not a job posting for a specific project. We will review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out to you. Advancing candidates may be invited to complete a timed HackerRank challenge to evaluate their technical skill set.<br><br><strong>Export Control Notice<br><br></strong>This role may require an export license for candidates with citizenship in certain countries (see current country list below – subject to change). Qualcomm, like other companies, is experiencing significant delays in the export license process. Please be advised that if an export license is required, you may not be able to start work with Qualcomm until the license is granted, which may impact your ability to participate in the internship.<br><br><strong>Countries requiring export</strong>: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Burma (Myanmar), Cambodia, China, Cuba, Georgia, Hong Kong, Iran, Iraq, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Laos, Libya, Macau, Moldova, Mongolia, Nicaragua, North Korea, Russia, Sudan, Syria, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Ukraine, Uzbekistan, Venezuela, Vietnam, and Yemen.<br><br><strong>Applicants</strong>: Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. Cisco values your ideas and encourages innovation. </span><span>You'll</span><span> develop your consulting skills while working with diverse customers in retail, healthcare, education, and the public/private sectors to craft and implement the right technical solutions for their business needs, regardless of their stage in the customer journey. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Ability to multi-task, self-start, work in </span><span>a</span><span> inclusive team environment and work independently. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with </span><span>ability</span><span> to solve technical problems. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Willingness to address new challenges and develop new skills. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Minimum Qualifications </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Currently enrolled in a certification program (e.g., Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College</span><span>), or</span><span> currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program. Relevant fields </span><span>include:</span><span> in Information Systems, Cyber Security, Computer Networking, Computer Science or Engineering </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Knowledge of IT systems, networking concepts, TCP/IP protocols, network </span><span>devices</span><span> and applications, and the OSI model. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Proficient in Python, REST APIs, Automation. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Able to legally live and work in the country for which </span><span>you’re</span><span> applying, without visa support or sponsorship </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Preferred Qualifications: </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Awareness and general understanding of how consumer applications work over the internet (e.g., Browser, Voice/Video calls, Social Networks, </span><span>Streaming</span><span> etc.). </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Comfortable with Data Analysis, crafting visualizations such as graphs and heatmaps. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><p></p><h1>Why Cisco? </h1><p>At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.</p><p>Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere. </p><p>We are Cisco, and our power starts with you. </p><p></p>

<p>Required Qualifications:</p><ul><li>HS Diploma and some advanced level training. </li><li>U.S. Citizenship.</li><li>Have completed progress toward&nbsp;a bachelor&rsquo;s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Foundational experience in an object-oriented programming language, preferably in Java, and exposure to software engineering processes.</li><li>Hands on programming experience through coursework and/or prior internships.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Ability to quickly adapt and learn new technologies and concepts.</li><li>Self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player.</li><li>Strong written and oral communication skills.</li></ul><p>Desired Qualifications:</p><ul><li>3.0 and above GPA.</li><li>Exposure to Agile software development processes.</li><li>Familiarity with web development frameworks and/or database technologies.</li><li>Exposure to cloud computing environments.</li></ul><p>#PeratonIntern</p> <p>Peraton is seeking Summer 2026 Software Engineer Interns to support our Internal Research &amp; Development (IRAD) program which will be conducted in our Herndon, VA, West Lafayette, IN or Blacksburg, VA offices.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Join our Technology and Engineering Software Delivery Center and support exciting, advanced research projects in areas such as communications, space, cybersecurity, defense, health, and mobile. You&rsquo;ll have the opportunity to work in a collaborative, supportive environment with our full-time staff, allowing you to grow your skills and your career while building experience in a variety of different projects and domains. You&rsquo;ll work in an Agile software development environment supporting requirements/story development, software architecture and design, software development, and unit/component testing.&nbsp; You&rsquo;ll also get the chance to obtain certifications in leading technologies to enhance your skills, such as Amazon Web Services.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the ten weeks (June to August) and commit to working a minimum of 35-40 hours per week. This program is geared toward technical college students, actively enrolled at a four-year university, who will be rising into their junior or senior years. However, strong underclassmen may be considered if they have declared their major and have completed qualified coursework.</p>
